Reviews.Title: “31/03/2012”
Reviews.Author: djdjdj61
Reviews.Content: This was booked in Dec for our trip Tue 27/3/12, arrived at hotel told " hotel repair works" they booked us into another 4star hotel for 1 night,..later found out they had LIED to us it was doubled booked!!!!! Double room small one bed pushed up against the wall by window ,bedside cabinet between beds had glass top that slid all over the top of cabinet very unsafe , bracket for a/c there but no controls in room what-so -ever ,one wall light had exposed nuts & screws other one was covered, pedal bin in bathroom broken could not open by foot,was told this was only room empty.....can see why now!!!!! Had to make 3 phones calls to get 2 more pillows Pigeons nesting outside window in well of the building despite have well covered in plastic wire to stop them . Loose very long electrical wire swinging from top of hotel ( when windy hitting window)when windy. All of these were reported to reception,if we went back think they would be the same!! THIS IS NEVER A 4STAR HOTEL, 2.5or AT A PUSH 3STAR, would advise people to sear clear of this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-worth to book it”
Reviews.Author: BRoks
Reviews.Content: Very good location, near tram station and clean area, nice stuff, good breakfast, nice rooms. Overall it's a deal comparing to price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over Christmas break enjoyed our visit and the staff

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: wizards35
Reviews.Content: Me and wife stayed at Carlton last month and all I can say is, this is the place to be! We loved it. We picked this hotel for the price and the location. We weren't wrong. I don't get all the bad reviews and bad staff comments. This hotel looks brand new inside and out. The room we stayed in was no different than Hyatt Jersey room. Staff was so friendly and with the help of their recommendations we ended up dining at the best restaurants and ate by awesome views of this beautiful city. I hope I am not spelling wrong if I do forgive me; Kaan (one of the staff) we can't thank you enough. We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “I'd book a better hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: ashishvb
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceptive they say - very true in case of the Carlton Hotel. The lobby is impressive, but once you enter the room, it showed how shoddily maintained the hotel was. The bathroom was unbelievable small. The air conditioning was noisy and stopped every 15 minutes...with the high summer temperature, this certainly didn't help. I had booked this hotel via a travel agent without checking the reviews before finalizing the booking...a real no-no.

Reviews.Title: “Will post pics of it so all can see how bad it is !!! Avoid this HOLE !!!”
Reviews.Author: hujzkurwamimasonami
Reviews.Content: Horrible is not enough. Spent one night week ago (oct 2011) did not step on the floor in room even in socks, state of a carpet never seen before even on grime fighters. 4 stars good Lord maybe monkey gave them. Wall with window the best, YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS, mould and fungus all over it, covered with courtain, was in complete shock !!!. Slept and could smell the FUNGUS, i dont know how this hotel is still open?????? I will recommend even my enemy STEER OF IT MILES AWAY as its rotten mouldy and SMELLY HOLE for 50 euro you can have a room somewere else a lot of it in Istanbul and will be heaven compared NOT THIS ONE. And juice of course as can read in other feedback but i gave it back and avoided paying 10 euro for 2 glasses. BE AWARE this may be and probably is top of the iceberg if they have rooms like this whats in the KITCHEN ??? SEE MY PICTURES !!! YOU WILL SEE WHY YOU NEED TO AVOID AT ALL COST !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Hotel, Istanbul, chosen by Pacha Tours, is Terrible”
Reviews.Author: KMcDon
Reviews.Content: Pacha Tours arranged for a fabulous tour with some pretty bad hotels. We just spent three days here at the end of a 24 day tour of Turkey. The rooms were dirty and tiny. The gold carpet was black with dirt. We were afraid to go barefoot. The bathroom was so small that the door hit the toilet and one had to maneuver around the open door, against the wall and shower, to get behind the door and close it to use the toilet. The half tub was cracked and dirty. It was difficult to manage the high step into the tub to take a shower. On our final day, yesterday, the water was as brown as an emory board so sponge baths at the sink were the best we could do. I complained to Koptur, the local tour company engaged by Pacha. The guest relations guy was indifferent and did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel cheats you!”
Reviews.Author: Didde P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Carlton for 4 night and cannot recommend the hotel. Basically we felt that the did their best to cheat us, and unfortunately succeded. 1: The hotel does not have a fitness center, as they write on their homepage 2: We did not touch the minibar, but still we were charged for having taking several items on the final bill. When we complained, they refused to change it. Also they had over charged us for breakfast, adding more than we had had, but also refused to change this. 3: They charged our credit card, before we were given the chance to see the bill, therefore, it was difficult to do anything about it. 3: They would only give us a receipt in Turkish, so it was very difficult to find out, that they were actually charging for. 4: For the first 2 nights the hotel was extremely cold. It was necessary to bring a jacket, when having breakfast, and we had to ask 2 times to get an extra blanket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kasiopi
Reviews.Content: I have staid in Carlton for three days.It is a nice hotel for the amount of money required.Polite stuff and good location if you are in Istanbul for trading otherwise I would suggest to choose another location.Taksim and Beyoglu are more preferable locations if you are in Istanbul for tourism and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “we would not recommend this hotel to anyone,the only good thing is the staff at reception specially mehmet and orjan,”
Reviews.Author: mahmoodayyaz
Reviews.Content: we had taken some gifts for our friends in turkey,but unfortunately the leather wallet was stolen from our room 501 when we were away on sight seeing on the third day. we have extensively travelled all over the world but this has never happened to us before

Reviews.Title: “good but not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: victoriafromgreece
Reviews.Content: -Negatives: The rooms smelt, the reception was not airconditioned, dinner very average,the bathroom floor wasn't cleaned. -Positives: very good breakfast,rooms good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Violet405
Reviews.Content: The breakfast selection is wide and will fit most taste buds. Beware of the enticing fresh orange juice which tastes lovely and refreshing until the waiter comes and bills you 5TL for it and this ends up leaving distaste in your mouth! Many of the guests including myself werenâ€™t aware of the charge and the cost all adds up when youâ€™re on holiday. The room was tidy and had a good size and the bathroom shower was nice to come back to have a relaxing shower at the end of a hot and sticky day. The hotel is on a side road so not much noise from traffic and it felt safe back late at night. If you like walking, it is well located and easy to get to all the main attractions in the Sultanahmet area and Bazaar district. Transport is close by too. Staff on the whole were friendly and bar the exception of one receptionist where when we asked for a map of the city, he tried to sell us one! We waited until the shift change to ask a different receptionist and we picked up a free one! If you have time and funds you should book in for a massage. The masseuse is very skilled with a lovely manner to match. Overall, a nice stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: thanks04
Reviews.Content: the hotel was quiet, clean, cozy. Breakfast was exellent, service friendly. Bazar was nearby, also the historical places quite near.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LappeenrantaSirpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in hotel Carlton with my husband, and I really can not complain about anything. Breakfast was marvellous, room clean and cosy, service friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but just so hot in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBoys
Reviews.Content: Few minutes walk down the road to the tram stop (Laleli-Universite). Few tram stops to the main tourist attractions (Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc). Very nice reception, bar area and breakfast room, however none of them were air-conditioned (that in Istanbul in August wasn't nice at all). The breakfast was so warm because of this (warm milk, warm fruit, warm meats and cheese, etc- not so pleasant). The room itself needs some DIY urgently: fix the carpet, paint the walls, fix the fridge, etc. The room it self was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worse experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: trekking-Georgia
Reviews.Content: I found and booked Carlton Hotel from Lastminute.com. From photos it looked like a medium level hotel: rooms not small, beds also looked normal. An only thing which I could not clarify that was a location (area). Location was not noted on the map, there was only street address, which was so small that could not find on the map. When we arrived we appeared in Laleli area (which is a market palace, there are only shops and traders) while I wanted to stay in Sultanahmed area (touristic center). Although I called to Lastminute.com and asked the location I was answered that that is in the center. That could be fine if the other things were ok, but... The room double was so small that there was only small bad and you could not move around. thanks god it was clean. shower cabine was also so small that there was no space to enter in.liquid soap is offered as a shampoo, hand and body wash. large conditioner was blowing directly to my head so I could not use it. TV was hengon right side of the bed and there was no way to watch normaly. the most important for me was internet connection, which appeared that is awailable only in lobby, while on the web site is noted that it is awailable in rooms. when I asked for help to the reception, they said that they have more important things to do so I should not disturb them for an hour. then they forgot. Thanks god I stayd there only for 4 nights and not more. Of couse I complained with the manager but nobody helped me, then I found a internet cafe and did my work there. This was not my first trip to Istanbul. I have stayed before in Hostels, butique hotels, and ordinary 3-4 star hotels but I have never had such horrible experience. so be careful when you book a hotel, please check the above things carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: BasakLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed Carlton Hotel in February 2010 for one week. I went to Turkey in my half term holiday (I am a student in London aged 27) for visiting my friends.Actually I have been there before Feb 2010 for visiting my friend who stayed there,but the hotel was different.After its redesigning,hotel is really beautiful and completely different.I am satisfied with all facilities,staff,services and the hygiene as well.Also hotel's location is close to airport and all historical places.Really helpful and cheerful staff..I am looking forward to go again in summer...

Reviews.Title: “more a 2 star than a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Mummymuz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2010. The hotel was spotlessly clean but the bathroom was small and freezing cold. Anyone with mobility problems or a little on the large side would have real problems using the shower. The breakfast was OK but I thought 5 lire for orange juice was terrible. More fresh fruit would have been nicer than 5 kinds of Feta cheese. In terms of location it is excellent. everything is within easy walking distance, even the tram back to the airport. There are several cheap eateries nearby and a good corner shop selling drinks etc at "normal" prices. A good central hotel to "get your head down" whilst on a city break, but no way is it a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: shakir222
Reviews.Content: i had a really great time here, the service was great and it was easy for me to get around location wise, it was very clean and nice the rooms were a good size, customer service was great also i did not have any problems at all, and i would stay again anytime. i have traveled all over the world and i really enjoyed my stay here, this place is a great place. the people were very nice and they really took good care of me and my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hakhak
Reviews.Content: Overall had a wonderful time. Staff was excellent and timely. Many facilities to enjoy. One of the better places to stay in Istanbul without spending too much

Reviews.Title: “central location, staff very good”
Reviews.Author: hoopadoopa
Reviews.Content: my 21year old daughter and i stayed her for 7 nights and found this hotel ok for the price, but never a 4 or 5 star more like a 2 or 3 star, the shower was way to small very hard to get in and out of (if you are a big person you would not be able to use it) the beds were very hard and low, and there was no tea/coffee or iron in the room, mini bar was very expensive as always, a small remark on Turkey itself, we had a lovely time but 7 nights was to long by 3 nights and the street sellers were hard to deal with in regards to them not taking no for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY”
Reviews.Author: katbadger
Reviews.Content: First of all our transfer from the airport didnt arrive .When we arrived they said they had no record of our booking and we had to practical loose our tempers before they suddenly found our booking.they wont even ring the travel company we booked with which was based in istanbul to confirm.. With the exception of one female receptionist the staff were not at all helpful. Our bathroom flooded during our stay and everthing had to asked for twice.we had to pay fro our transfer back to the airport which was supposed to be free. they have a nice spa though.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: Lebanesetourist
Reviews.Content: When we wanted to travel,we checked trip advisor and we got worried, but really,it was a wonderful stay. Good things : - clean - polite - helpful receptionists - great location 10 min walking from sulaimaniya mosque - 10 min walking to reach the train. - gave us good prices for orient show - daily trips. For real its not an elegant hotel but perfect for people who are searching for a clean calm hotel. note:don't eat doner shawerma near the hotel its awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a wonderfull place, not a real 4 stars hotel, maybe 2 stars...”
Reviews.Author: RedRoseRo
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for first time in february, 2008 with my friends for shopping. We went to Carton hotel, which is not at all a 4 stars hotel, I can give just 2 poor stars. The room was pretty nice and not very small but the bathroom too small. The view from window was acceptable because we could see the main street which was not bad in fact. But the breakfast was too poor, we didn't have too much things to choose, the meal was very poor. The stuff was not friendly, which is not good at all in if you are in another unknown country. The location was very nice, near major touristic attractions, not far from anything important. We decided to come back the next mounth because we spent only 3 days there which seem to be not enough for us. We returned in march to same hotel because we didn't look for another. We regreted then because was an awfull experience, it was worse than first time. In room everything was broken, the light didn't work, the food was miserable, the stuff more angry and bored than last time, and the window view was like a garaj or something for cars, they were working all day in an infernal noise and a lot of dust. We asked to change the room but they couldn't. We promised to ourselves to never return there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Stars hotel! 2? May be!”
Reviews.Author: planet60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton Hotel in Istanbul, September 2008. By international standards, itâ€™s only a 2 stars hotel. I found the hotel staff polite and mostly helpful. The breakfast was excellent. Good location â€“ close to almost every thing you want to see in old Istanbul. The hotel looks good from outside, nice lobby, but every thing else was sub standard : small rooms, very very small shower stall (taking shower was a challenge), towels looked more like rags, no working air conditioner and windows open to nowhere ! If you have young children , be aware of 2 pornographic channels on the TV. You may want to ask them to remove the TV as these channels cannot be locked. There is only one internet connection in lobby; it is not free - costs 4 euros/hour. If you need a printer, there is an extra cost. I went to the reception to get my money back for the printer that did not work, I was told that the hotel is not responsible for the comuter/internent/printer!

Reviews.Title: “Just 2 stars. NOT 4.”
Reviews.Author: Holderlin
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Carlton Hotel in Istambul on februaryÂ´s first week 2008. If they would work on finishings it could be a very nice 3 stars hotel, but right now, on international standards, itÂ´s only a 2 stars hotel. I got surprised when found 2 pornographic channels on the TV, and when kindly complained about it at the reception they just said: Â¨itÂ´s freeÂ¨ and, very surprised, asked me if Â¨you donÂ´t like them?Â¨ So, this isnÂ´t a hotel for families or normal turists. At the minibar I found 2 bottles of mineral water already opened by another clients and carefull filled with plain water (I guess), I said it to the Reception and, after 5 days, when I left, the bottles were there waiting for another clients... The Buffet Breakfast is like nothing and you must pay for omelettes or fried eggs. Incredible. The internet at the Reception costs 4 euros/hour. So, if you may find another hotel in the area which may be really better, donÂ´t hesitate. But, itÂ´s a pity, as the hotel looks nice and needs just simple renovations (my room, 706, was ok), a lot more care by the owner/s, and some more things.

Reviews.Title: “Just acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Nastya_Aktau
Reviews.Content: It is a typical hotel for this district I suppose. Be aware of the rooms with the windows looking into the inner shaft - as I guess in any hotel here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: 34mirage
Reviews.Content: On the hotel website, they claim to be the best 4 star in the area! This is an outrageous lie as all the nearby hotels are much better. The Carlton would struggle to make it to a 3 star minus. In spite of my reminder 2 days before, we were left stranded at the airport at 4 o'clock in the morning even though the transfer was included in the package which we booked straight from the hotel. Some of the staff simply ignored our complaints and we were passed on from one employee to another without ever managing to speak to anyone with the authority to take a decision. We had to pay for the taxi to the hotel and they even had the cheek to charge us for a soft drink from the bar. The package comprised some excursions and on the one to Bursa, we were on the coach for 16 hours with screaming children which drove us crazy. The last stretch was 8 hours long non stop and we got back to the hotel at midnight. No food was available and the rude night receptionist simply walked away when I asked whether we could buy a sandwich from the hotel or anywhere nearby. The lifts are a serious hazard and would not pass the basic standards in Europe. The Carlton is a shambles and do yourselves a favour - walk away.
